title: How to Find Array Size in Java

steps.headline: Open the IDE.
steps.description: Open your IDE of choice, or write the code and execute it through the Command Prompt.

steps.headline: Copy and paste the following code:
steps.description: class Size { static int[] numbers = {1, 225, 231, 4, 675}; public static void main(String[] args) { int size = numbers.length; System.out.println("The size of array is : "+size); } }

steps.headline: Run the program.
steps.description: The output will be The size of array is : 5.

steps.headline: Understand what the program does.
steps.description: Once you understand how the .length statement works, you can use it in other contexts easily. You declare a Integer array numbers with the values : [1. 225, 231, 4, 675]. Next, you use the statement "numbers.length" to get the size of Integer array numbers and assign it to Integer variable size. Then you print the size of the Integer array numbers.
